subject: Photography
title: ISO: Sensitivity to Light
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: ISO: Sensitivity to Light.

hook.text: When there's not enough light, you can make your sensor more sensitive. The tradeoff? Grain.

buildup.text: ISO measures the sensor's sensitivity to light. ISO 100 is low sensitivity; ISO 6400 is high.

discovery.text: Higher ISO amplifies the signal from the sensor â€” like turning up volume. You hear more, but also more static.

twist.text: That static is called noise â€” grainy speckles that degrade image quality. High ISO is a last resort, not a first.

climax.text: Modern sensors handle high ISO far better than older ones. What was unusable at ISO 3200 is now clean at 12800.

punchline.text: ISO turns up the light â€” and the noise.
